metadata.title: CVE-2016-1000111 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
Twisted before 16.3.1 does not attempt to address RFC 3875 section 4.1.18namespace conflicts and therefore does not protect CGI applications fromthe presence of untrusted client data in the HTTP_PROXY environmentvariable, which might allow remote attackers to redirect a CGIapplication's outbound HTTP traffic to an arbitrary proxy server via acrafted Proxy header in an HTTP request, aka an "httpoxy" issue.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1000111` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-twisted - 17.9.0-1
python-twisted-bin - 17.9.0-1
python-twisted-core - 17.9.0-1
python-twisted-mail - 17.9.0-1
python-twisted-names - 17.9.0-1
python-twisted-news - 17.9.0-1
python-twisted-runner - 17.9.0-1
python-twisted-web - 17.9.0-1
python-twisted-words - 17.9.0-1
python3-twisted - 17.9.0-1
python3-twisted-bin - 17.9.0-1
python-twisted-conch - 1:17.9.0-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: twisted package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '17.9.0-1').
twisted package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '17.9.0-1').
